wiki.summary: “Clouded” illustrates Brent’s obsession with how he will be remembered or whether he will have had a meaningful impact on the world before he dies. He muses on the actual significance of what society has taught us, on what is most important: sex, money, and drugs, and displays part of his “idgaf” attitude while providing his troublesome experiences in life and an insight into his unhappy feelings. “A lot of (the rap-leaning on Clouded) is due to Nascent…I wanted to answer questions people ask on some day-to-day shit. Read more on Last.fm.
wiki.content: “Clouded” illustrates Brent’s obsession with how he will be remembered or whether he will have had a meaningful impact on the world before he dies. He muses on the actual significance of what society has taught us, on what is most important: sex, money, and drugs, and displays part of his “idgaf” attitude while providing his troublesome experiences in life and an insight into his unhappy feelings. “A lot of (the rap-leaning on Clouded) is due to Nascent…I wanted to answer questions people ask on some day-to-day shit. “What are you thinking about? Or why is your energy so low?” I use “Clouded” as an opportunity to address that.“ - Brent Faiyaz “Clouded” was certified gold by the RIAA on June 9, 2021. Read more on Last.fm.
